website_summaries.verdict: The basic original Stomp Rocket that doesn't cost a lot and provides hours of fun.
pros: Can shoot up to 200 feet high
Low-tech toy that gets even high-tech obsessed kids outside playing
For the price, this toy packs a lot of entertainment value
cons: This rocket can only shoot in a vertical position
Lots of fun, but gets torn up over time

customer_reviews.title: Take a few minutes to make a stand that will last.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with the worthless stand. Cut a 10"X12" piece of plywood, screwed an angle construction bracket ($1.50 Home Depot) to wood, measure and drilled hole to attach hose assembly. Use equal to Shoe Goo on rocket fins - sticks to anything. Now ready to play with grandsons. No wood? Check with Sup at home construction site. Don't complain, find solutions.
customer_reviews.author: S. McG

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of junk - do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap piece of JUNK! The 3 small pieces of plastic that are suppose to serve as the base are so flimsy and poorly made they don’t stay together long enough to support a single launch. The stomp cushion is made of pretty hard plastic that looks like it will crack and break, making it completely obsolete. We used it a few times and my kids (and I too) wee so frustrated having to pur it back together every other launch... i literally boxed it up to return it within minutes of opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Woodul

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Three grandsons love this (ages 6, 4, 2). Had a cheaper one previously that was hard for little ones to stomp hard enough to get the rocket to blast off. This rocket, however, is well-built, easy enough that a 2 year old can stomp hard enough to make it go off, and, added bonus, angle of rocket can pivot so you can target objects. A real plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kimime

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for youngsters
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simply toy, but young children really enjoy it. They get to jump on something, and see an immediate effect - the rocket soars upward. Although it is listed as appropriate for ages 5 and up, our 2 1/2 year old grandson loves it. A 5 year old can probably operate it independently, while our grandson requires some adult assistance (and supervision :) ). The stand for the rocket is easily assembled. Take note - it also falls apart easily, so either some duct tape, or - better yet - some cable ties come in handy, to help it stay together.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great active toy for preschoolers
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been a hit with anyone that we have introduced it to! My son is almost 5, and he enjoys this toy. It's a great birthday present for active preschoolers! My younger son who is almost 3 can manage to play with this too! Anyone who can jump, or let alone take a step, can manage to use this toy. It's so simple yet genius! A great way to get some energy out.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: This entertained our grandkids for an hour nonstop at the park ( I had to say we were leaving) So much fun that other parent came to inquire about them. A lot of running and stomping, retrieving, counting and blast offs, getting creative. Four rockets ( not foam, sturdier) meant others running to retrieve not standing impatiently. A lot of bang for the buck and excellent outdoor activity. I purchased some of these previously for a space themed birthday party. You want the ones that say 200 feet unless you have a tiny yard. Can angle The projection or straight up, kids had fun experimenting.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Although this product has apparently been around a long time, I had never heard of it. Someone brought one to my daughter's on New Year's Eve, and the lady's son, my two great grandsons, and in fact, everyone from 3 to 78 had fun "stomping." The product works well, kids love it, but it looks like something that will not hold up under heavy kid use. No big deal since it's not that expensive.
customer_reviews.author: FresnoDick

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, good value, don't expect it to last.
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this toy. He likes stomping on it himself, but really loves it when I do it--it's typically the difference between a 20ft launch and a 150ft+ one. Your experience may be similar if you have children under the age of 8 or so. After a half dozen uses, one or two fins are torn and the foam tips are starting to show signs of wear. I don't expect our set of three to remain complete very long, but we'll enjoy them as long as we can.
customer_reviews.author: ZDFTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Please Read This Before Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: So the reviews were really good for this. I bought it for $15.00 but I'm really not happy with it. My kids are 5, 7 & 8 and like the idea of this but it just isn't functional. The yellow stand it comes with is garbage. Literally falls apart in 3 pieces after one or two times stomping on the toy to make it go. It goes high.. it's worth five bucks though. They carry around launcher part without the yellow stand.... we've lost 2 rockets so far within 2 days. buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 10 minutes before it broke. Had to duct tape it together before i even used it cause it wouldnt stand up. Then after 5 times my 3 year old cracked the tube. Its crap. Dont buy it. Spend the extra cash and get the one with 2 launchers.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: The children loved it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a birthday gift to a six year old who is isolating during covid with an 11 year old. They loved it. They had energy to burn and in their opinion, half the fun was that adults had to climb trees to dislodge the rockets they had deliberately aimed there. We all had a good laugh. I thought maybe after the first fun they would abandon it but they continue to find new games to play with it. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KL in MA

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Toy that Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: The rocket propelled system works fine. Although, only an adult seems to be able to shoot it upwards of the 200 feet that it claims to go. My four-year-old can only get it about 10 to 15 feet in the air. The biggest negative to this toy is the flimsy stand that comes with it. It literally falls apart every time you stomp on the air cushion. Also it is nearly impossible to bend the hose so that the rocket. Straight up. Because of this the toy is nearly on usable without somebody sitting and holding the rocket launch pad. I cannot recommend purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A. Dix

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought a cheaper stomp rocket on Amazon's Woot website and my kids quickly loved it to death. I ordered this one and they love it so much more than the first. This toy is fun and bound to get you up on your roof retrieving rockets at some point. The kids play with it at least once a week for the past month and a half. Overall, really fun toy and have gifted it to some friends already.
customer_reviews.author: Stupid People are Annoying

customer_reviews.title: STRONG TOY
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 3 year old nephew but became great outdoor fun for the whole family. 3 year old loved it and could stomp and jump on the launcher without problem, sending the "rocket" into the sky about 20 feet. The adults didn't hold back after a few trials and the toy held up to the heavy feet and launched the rockets extremely high, not 200 feet, but more like 75-100. Very fun trying to catch them on their way down too! Soft nerf and lightweight plastic made the toy safe and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Cool!
customer_reviews.text: This was way more entertaining than I expected! The rockets can actually really go high and pick up speed from the wind so be sure you don't do it in a small yard with close neighbors! We did it in the street, away from cars because it has a pretty hard landing for such a light little rocket. But my daughter and I had a lot of fun taking turns with it, big fun for her!
customer_reviews.author: erika b.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent outdoor toy!
customer_reviews.text: The gown ups were having a rocket day...”for the kids” lol. There is a lot of down time between launches, and 5 year olds get bored. Soooo mommy got this for the kids in between the launches. They had SO MUCH FUN! Fantastic! Take it camping, backyard fun, wherever, it’s an amazing way to get them active!
customer_reviews.author: My review

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Stomp rockets work fine and little kids love them. These rocket bodies are made from hard plastic tubes. Once your kid steps on one it will never fly right again. Rockets made from foam are much more durable and fun for the whole family. Launcher is also a pain to assemble for kids and comes apart during play. They do fly high though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul  McRann

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old granddaughter. At first she was not impressed because it looked like a boy's toy. Once her dad took her out and they used the rocket, she was thrilled. It is very light weight and so this stomp rocket even goes on hikes and family picnics. It is fun and has held up very well. Two thumb's up!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Gal

customer_reviews.title: Start off with these, not the cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.text: Started off with inexpensive foam stomp rockets, which were a huge hit. They didn't last long (1 week) Upgraded to these. They are one of the kids favorite, and they hold up longer than the previous ones. The center tube is plactic and the nose is a denser foam rubber. 6 months later these are still intact and flying high.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Neighborhood kids of all ages enjoying the Stomp Rocket, and some adults too
customer_reviews.text: So far, all likes. Almost no assembly. Play started a minute after the box was opened. The rockets have been shot impressive distances. Soft nosecones has meant not being worried about anyone getting hurt. Kids of all ages from around the neighborhood have come over to stomp. A few adults too. Lots of fun for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: MarkTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very good toy ; could be made stronger
customer_reviews.text: This rocket set I bought for grandson , and he loved it. It works well, and is simple to assemble. His uncle , who was husky and portly , jumped on it, and the rocket expired there on the spot. Yet, for the short time we had it, it was fun. We had a farmyard to use it. Large fields work well. It flies high in sky, too. I believe the toy could be made better. It is a bit cheaply made, and that, and portly and husky uncle, is why toy broke. Concept is great. No batteries needed.
customer_reviews.author: Icelandic wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Almost unusable! The stand doesn't hold even its self up. Once the rocket is on there it falls. Someone has to sit and hold it straight
customer_reviews.author: Hines57

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool! And sturdy! The darts are fairly flemsy but i did let my 4 n 2 year old play with it. Im pretty sure it was my 2 year old who tore them up the most lol so if buying for a little older its no problem. My 10 and 13 year olds also play with it. It launches extremely well and seems very sturdy in that area. Being a mother this was one of my favorite gifts as far as quality for a good price goes.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Outdoor Gift for the 4-8 plus Group!
customer_reviews.text: The Original Stomp Rocket is my favorite "go to" gift for the 4-8 year old group. Of course, children of all ages love them - younger and older! We have even had the adults out there stomping! Easy to use and it is great outdoor fun. I purchased this one for a five year old and he is still thanking me for the "greatest present ever"! He and his older brother (7) spent hours outside playing. As a side note, we have also purchased the Stomp Rocket Junior and love that as well!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 & 6 year old and we spent hours launching this. We brought a tape measure with us so we could see how far it went and tracked who’s went the farthest. We loved this and will use it over and over to see how far we can launch. Oh we also set up targets to try to have it land on or near so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works great but doesn’t stay together
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons 5th birthday and he loves it! The base does not stay together very well at all but I can use some zip ties to hold it together! I was afraid after a few jumps it would break but it didn’t.. it just fell apart. I even jumped on it a few times and it didn’t break! Zip ties to hold it together will definitely come in handy! Not that I should need them to keep it held together. I’m still pleased with how well it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept for it. It is a fun toy for my daughter. However, whoever thought the base of the launcher piecing together the way it does was a good idea, needs fired. Not only fired, but publicly shamed. My 6 year old could have come up with a better and more efficient way to piece it together. The only comparable example is North Koreas missile program. Looks cool, but it's a gamble weather or not it will clear the launch pad.
customer_reviews.author: Walter F

customer_reviews.title: Best gift idea for kids EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my son for his birthday and all my kids ages 2-8 love it! We have spent HOURS shooting it off at the park! The stand is a little bit flimsy and comes apart every so often as they are playing with it, but for the price and the fact that it is so easy to take apart and put away it’s still totally worth it! My kids never get sick of it and they actually get it super super high in the sky! For less than $20 this is totally worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Mamaof4

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun for a seven year old
customer_reviews.text: My seven-year-old boy enjoys this, and it's part of our covid plan. The rocket can go up about 50-60 feet. The base tilts, so that he can shoot it either vertically or at an angle. He's used it for about six play sessions and the rockets are all intact.
customer_reviews.author: History guy

customer_reviews.title: so I was a little disappointed with this one
customer_reviews.text: Ok......so I was a little disappointed with this one. It works as it says. My three rowdy boys LOVED playing with it. However, the plastic stand that the rockets sit on is cheap and flimsy. It kept bending with the weight of the rocket (which is only light foam) and falling over. Assembly was pretty easy but that darn stand is a joke. It should have been metal. But hey.....I guess that's what you get for under ten dollars.
customer_reviews.author: monika

customer_reviews.title: Flies high, but not "20 stories"
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun with younger kids. Easy to assemble the stand, and even that can be a fun family activity that makes (small) kids feel useful and handy. Then you have all the target practice, etc. out in the yard. However.... "20 stories high" like the write-up says?? Noooooo waaaaay. I'd guess about four stories, and that's with me (Dad) stomping on the launcher. Misleading write-up is the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Goodeknight

customer_reviews.title: 5 minutes of fun
customer_reviews.text: Goes nowhere near the height it says & after landing on the ground a few times, if any dirt granules get in it, it barely launches. My kids were over it in 5min bc it progressively shot up lower and lower. Only used it once in about 2 months. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dgleason

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for wild animal kids
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6YO. Instant hit. What kid doesn’t love jumping up and stomping on something only to have a rocket shoot off into the air. It’s plastic and foam and won’t last forever but rugged enough to take some abuse. My son loves it. Note that If/when used inside this can be mildly, dangerous/destructive. The rockets launch off of this thing with some force. Can be aimed to different angles so that you don’t just have to shoot straight up. Even if it only last a few days/weeks, it’s well worth the price of admission.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for outdoor fun!
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids 7and 5, boy and girl, had fun playing with this rocket in our yard for about an hour at a time competing and catching it in flight. They needed assistance with assembly to get started. I only gave 4 stars for durability because the stand kept coming apart. We will put it together with plastic ties next time they visit to eliminate frustration of kids and grandparents.
customer_reviews.author: Born to Read

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: No stars given. Absolutely one of the worst products ever made. Legs won't stay assembled and most importantly air never gets to rocket from stomper. Not even worthy to be at a dollar store. Too bad waited to take it for birthday gift camping and missed out on return window.
customer_reviews.author: TXMomto5

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our little boy for his 4th birthday. It was a HUGE hit! He loves playing with it in the yard, and he is able to do it completely on his own. (He also loves for his daddy to launch the rockets extra high! 😜) I would recommend for girls and boys, young and old. Fun for everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my 4 year old! She spent hours outside playing with it. Her dad even started playing with it..... Her grandparents played with it and her uncle's loved it too! It was definitely the highlight of our summer so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Given as a gift I wanted to play with
customer_reviews.text: This was given to my 6 year old nephew who just adored it. His older cousins were able and shoot the rocket higher, but they all had a blast playing with this toy. It works well. Avoid trees when using though. The light-weight rockets can get stuck up in them. Fortunately we were able to get them down.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Not very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3of these for my grandkids , they opened them on April 19th as easter gifts, they were so excited but after 15 minutes of constantly having to put the tri pod back together they got bored. My grand kids are 7 6 and 5 an they loved it when the stand would stay together the rockets did fly pretty high but even i could of invented a better stand for the laucher. Not very good quality i would send them back but my granddaughter got the duck tape out and the kids duct tape the stands together. I was to say the least disappointed in the product would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best mechanical toy for Kid's burning energy
customer_reviews.text: As described, the toy goes around 200 ft high by hitting hard. Kids easily get full exercise if they go out with this toy! There are no major air leaking and pipes seems to be pretty good! My kid plays at least 1 hour per day from the time I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Shwetha

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations, but this thing is keeping my GIRLS entertained for hours. Great imagination toy, plus chasing the rockets gets a good workout in. I will be gifting these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Dudley

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how my kids have spent so much time playing with this. I figured it would keep them occupied for 10 minutes! we are going on 2ish days of them playing with it!!! I mean, for random periods of time all day long ... not a consistent couple hours lol. but still. they love it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: shawna Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts easy to break
customer_reviews.text: My boys absolutely love these! The only problem and why I gave 3 stars is the rockets are made of cheap plastic. Once my boys used them a couple of times, the plastic wings came off and the rocket itself cracked. Have to buy replacements. But again boys do love
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Both 4 & 8 year old boys love this stomp rocket! The stand is very difficult to put together and keep together. But they take turns holding and aiming it instead. Cheap materials so it won’t last too long but price reflects that and they love it so much I’d buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We love stomp rockets at our house! We have 2 different sets and love them both. Super easy, no loud noises or batteries needed. Just simple, kid fun! No real assembly necessarily...just open the box, put the stand onto the hose and you are ready to rock! Don't go TOO close to your house or they will end up on the roof!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy with a terrible stand
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 5th bday. Him and his 3 year old brother get a huge kick out of stomping and jumping on the "trigger" to see how far they can shoot their rockets. This is a great outside toy for just about any age group. The only thing we did not like about it is the legs that come with it are ridiculously cheap and actually junk. We had to rig up our own stand with some old wood we had lying around and some tape. Now they can aim it any direction they choose and it wont tip over like the junk plastic stand that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: MartaBennett

customer_reviews.title: Such a "Blast"!
customer_reviews.text: The three year old little boy that I watched absolutely LOVED this toy. He could not get enough of it, and he continued to play with it each day/week that I came to watch him. It is such a simple set-up, and overall, good quality. The only thing that I found was that the rockets that come with it can crack easily if stepped on... Make sure to get some fun backup rockets to go with it! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter and 4 year old son had hours of fun with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Fun times with it
customer_reviews.text: My kids aged 6 and 3 love this thing. We have to take this to the park because they can make this go far depending on the angle. It’s a little flimsy for the price and after a few uses the rockets are showing wear and tear. So I don’t know how long they’ll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: CatG

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Fun
customer_reviews.text: As a kid, I made "chinaberry shooters" (PC for guns). This works on the same principle (air pressure projectile). It, however will not 'put somebody's eyes out'. It is actually fun and safe for this old man, the Grands the kid next door (and her mother). Because of weather, I have allowed limited use indoors without any damage. Go with the LED refills because the non lighted become useless as dusk approaches. I have one 'con'. The launch tube holder is not very good (it was better when I staked it). Thanks to indoor use, we have found holding and pointing the launch tube both safer and more fun. WILL BUY AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old LOVES it!!
customer_reviews.text: It gets 4 stars because my kid absolutely loves this thing. Only toy he consistently plays with every time he is outside -and he has A LOT to choose from. The rockets don't last long and I had to tape the stand together to keep it upright but it works and I'll order new rockets when I have to.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Not all rockets worked but fun!
customer_reviews.text: This toy offered many hours of fun for a 3, 7, 9, and 11 year old. They truly fly so high/far. Unfortunately not all of the rockets work, otherwise we would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tallie

customer_reviews.title: Missing a shipping box
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect gift for our active grandson. It's unfortunate that the shipping was substandard. It arrived on the day as promised but the product was not packaged within a shipping box, a label was stuck to the outside of the products manufacturers packaging and shipping damaged the outer packaging... alot.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce D

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing. Really cheap materials. Unlikely that this ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Really cheap materials. Unlikely that this will be used again after one time of trying it out. Definitely only for smaller children, and at that, the product will not hold up to any wear and tear whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn Adams

customer_reviews.title: Party supply
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend it for the kids party. The kids was so happy to jump and push the button. It is working great even after using by 8 kind in a raw with nonstop playing.
customer_reviews.author: Venera

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: It was fun when it lasted. It didn’t last that long. We bought it for our 4YO. The pressure stomper broke very quickly. We didn’t use it a lot either. It’s a cute idea. Maybe buy something of a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rishi R.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this toy. I even had a blast for it. I got it for my nephew for his birthday and he plays with it non stop. So much fun. Good price and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, flimsy plastic base
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for the around-K age group and kids have a lot of fun and a great workout launching rockets in the air and then collecting them. However, I found the plastic connect-3-legs base to be very flimsy and the launch pipe is held supposedly straight up by a single screw - and with just a little bit of a pull the kids can move it from vertical to an angle and launch the rocket into the neighbor's fenced yard. So, one star off because I had to employ duct tape liberally to strengthen the base connections and make sure the launch pipe stays vertical at all times.I wish they'd ship a more substantially weighted base.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gafton

customer_reviews.title: Below average
customer_reviews.text: Well, a couple of rockets were not usable since day one. The diameter is not the same across the pieces and makes it very hard for some toddlers to play with it
customer_reviews.author: Babak

customer_reviews.title: The kids love this -- all of them
customer_reviews.text: The kids love this -- all of them. Ours, theirs, the neighbors, this is childhood at its best. We saw this for the first time at a birthday party when the parents were trying to entertain a plethora of kids and someone got smart and pulled this bad boy out. It was an instant hit. With a parent in charge lining the kids up so everyone took their turn in order, it was what all of the tv commercials offer but rarely deliver -- endless fun for all ages. One parent literally pulled up his Amazon app on his phone and purchased his right on the spot there in middle of the lawn. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy for my 5 year old to put together himself(like little independent people like to do), and a lot of fun. He played with this for hours straight. Definitely doesn't reach 200 deep though, and we had some big people trying!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Davis

customer_reviews.title: Hit for whole family
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the expensive and wazoo gifts our kids got for Christmas, this was the hit for the whole family! Super cool to have adjustable base so you Cain aim the rocket trajectory. Lots of active fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas  Larkin

customer_reviews.title: A classic!
customer_reviews.text: We've given Stomp Rockets to our own kids, to friends and family, and now to our 2-year old grandson. Just load a rocket onto the launcher, JUMP on the air-pad, and look skyward to watch your rocket soar! A fun activity that also offers many points-of-departure for science learning.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: A huge hit during the quarantine
customer_reviews.text: Super fun for my six year old. Easy to clean up and set up. And the rockets don’t stray too far from center so they don’t run the risk of being lost in the neighbors yard.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Stomp Rocket a Hit for Kids and Adults...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson for his Easter basket. It was a hit right off the bat! Not only with my grandson but my grand daughter and the adults also. Everyone was seeing how high they could make it fly! Our only complaint is (and it is a minor complaint) is that the stand kept (keeps) falling off) but it can be fixed in a jiffy...it is just a hassle to have the kids stop playing with it so we can put it back together. Considered gluing it but then it won't fit back in the box for storage......The kids love it and have a great time with it. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Padap1113

customer_reviews.title: Popular at the park
customer_reviews.text: This thing is always a hit at the park. Everyone wants to play with it. Good luck getting it to fit back in the box! But once it’s out you’re kids are going to want to play all the time. It goes pretty high, but if you want one of those insane skyscraper height ones this isn’t it. Goes maybe 2-3 stories. My 5 and 2 yo love it. I’ve used it a few times (~175 lbs) and it’s held up no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic and a P shooter compared to a "rocket_
customer_reviews.text: 200 feet it says. Yeah that's a no. With the plastic being a questionable quality and the in sturdiness of the whole thing I wouldn't be jumping or stomping this to much.. leave it to the kids to let it go 25 feet or so even if the kids cry they want it to go higher.
customer_reviews.author: russell ference

customer_reviews.title: Best $15 I have ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: Tthis is my grandson's favorite, and my favorite, too! He comes to our house about 4 days a week to do homework and wait for his mom to pick him up after work and without exception we play with this toy every time. There is something about watching these things blast off especially when somebody catches one in the screws. Whoaaaa, jeeeezzzz! We angle the launcher down range and see who can send one the farthest. From 7 to 67 we are all having fun laughing, celebrating, whooping and hollering, and building really good memories. Absolutely the best $15 I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Life is Good

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gift for my sons 6th birthday. So the “legs” come in three pieces. Once you put them together they will consistently fall apart unless it’s on a completely even surface. Any type of grass, unsmooth or uneven cement and it falls loose. I had to hold it in my place for my son to use. After two or three uses the darts became dented and bent. My son was so disappointed at how much time I spent fiddling with it that he lost interest. Do not buy it, find a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go to gift
customer_reviews.text: Stomp rocket is my go to gift this year for kids. Kids love watching the rockets blast into "space." Aiming the rocket helps prevent losing the rocket. Perfect stem toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stomp, shoot, reload.
customer_reviews.text: There were instructions on the box yet not on a piece of paper in the box. I found it a bit frustrating to assemble but it was a lot of fun to play with! The rockets blasted high, were easy to reload and made of quality material. I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Seashells

customer_reviews.title: The kids totally madly love this toy.
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift to three boys, age 2, 3 and 4. They already had one stomp rocket, so we thought this would let them play with two sets at once. But no, the new red head was a hit. Also, the sound is more interesting. They played for about an hour and at nap time, two boys took a rocket to bed with them!!! Got up, played the rest of the day with it! OMG! So simple a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Steel

customer_reviews.title: Does not last very long
customer_reviews.text: The rockets could be made sturdier. I gave them to all the grandkids. The rockets crack and fall apart fast. The kids loved it I bought a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: mary margaret hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My only complaint is I wish it was a little sturdier. My 2.5 year old begged for one after playing with the neighbors. We gave it to him as a reward for potty training and he loves it so much. However, he easily tore the side peices off.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boys (3 and 5) they absolutely loved it! They play with it outside all the time!! They see how far they can launch it and it's pretty fun watching them run after it. Great for all their energy. Will buy this again when/if this one breaks. They are pretty rough with it and it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: fit the bill
customer_reviews.text: my only complaint is I wish the stand was more sturdy - it's 3 pieces that fit together and it comes apart without too much fuss - a little high maintenance. I wrapped something around the pieces that is keeping it together, so it's working okay. Good product - our kid loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Gascoigne

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a week
customer_reviews.text: If it would have lasted more than a week it would have been a nice gift but for $18 worth of enjoyment for less than a week, ehhhh, NOT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.author: B W

customer_reviews.title: These are great fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: These are great fun for the kids! We purchased for our nephew who we knew would love to watch the rockets fly. He's also autistic so when he starts stomping as part of his stemming, he can now stomp on the rocket and be distracted with this. Great gift for kids and also great to play outdoors with friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gina F.

customer_reviews.title: So fun, but launchers don’t last long and break.
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint I have is after literally 10 uses I now have to buy more launchers bc they have broken! It’s expensive when u realize it doesn’t last long!
customer_reviews.author: A. GaNun

customer_reviews.title: Worked and was a lot of fun - Till it broke in 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It worked and my kids had a good time with it, but it broke in only 20 minutes. We didnt abuse it or anything, its just made of cheap/thin plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: It was flimsy when we put it together. The kids kind of just gave up. It would be fun if the base was more sturdy. I suggested taping it but haven't gotten around to doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my 4 year old son. He loved it! So did my 6 year old daughter, my husband and myself. Great outdoor summer gift. We turned it into a game to see who could launch it the farthest! Encourages exercise running to pick up darts and could be a great science discussion too when they are a bit older! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t keep it together or flat on the ground. The plastic parts did not stay together I had to tape them together so the kids could finally play with it. Just not worth the aggravation and frustration that went along with the product. Looking for something a little more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: 2-year old bday party hit
customer_reviews.text: I know the box says 5 and up but my two year old nephew and his friends and no problems putting the rockets in place and jumping on them, to do it all over again! They surprisingly got the rockets pretty high up in the air - It was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Leah B

customer_reviews.title: Shoots really high
customer_reviews.text: My son and daughter absolutely love this toy but unfortunately the rockets busted fairly easily and once theres the slightest crack they don't shoot up, I will be ordering more rockets because all and all it's a great toy and the kids enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Not super durable.
customer_reviews.text: My kid LOVED this product, but the rockets proved pretty flimsy. First hte fins came off, which I was fine with, but then the barrels broke
customer_reviews.author: Derek P.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for littles.
customer_reviews.text: 5 and 2 year old love it! Easy simple to use and the launcher seems pretty durable. Four stars because the rockets are a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Big hit with the kids
customer_reviews.text: This is so fun. I like that you can adjust the base so you can aim it in different directions. Kids have had it for two weeks and still aren't tired of it yet
customer_reviews.author: Pathfinder Solutions

customer_reviews.title: It lasts
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our nephew. We didn't know how long it would last, but it was still working 7 months later, after multiple uses. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harms

customer_reviews.title: Stomp away!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for little ones- my 5 and 7 year old love seeing how high this can go. They can entertain themselves without me having to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn D

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it ...but does it have to be so expensive?
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it ...but does it have to be so expensive? The quality is average to say the least for the cost we are paying.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Already ordered 3!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this.. so do all kids at the park. Bought a second one and then gifted to friend who said her kid is loving it!!! Worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be made sturdier
customer_reviews.text: We bought this For a four-year-old boy. kept him entertained 30 minutes or longer. The stand comes apart very easily needs to be built sturdier and the Rockets get bent easily when they hit the ground. other than that we had a blast watching him play with it and playing with it with him.
customer_reviews.author: Cathi Hamen

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old nephew for his birthday. It has been a huge hit! He and my niece love to play with it!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail E

customer_reviews.title: Really great for a five year old boy!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son for his fifth birthday, and he LOVES it! He always wants to take it to the park to use it. It says it's for older children, but I think it's just fine for his age group. As a warning, this will attract a crowd at the park, so don't get it if you don't want all the other kids coming to play and wanting a turn. ;) The kids love to run and jump on it, and never get tired of seeing how high they can launch the rockets. Definitely has given a lot of fun for the money. Other parents ask me where I got this all the time.
customer_reviews.author: TheMomReview

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to keep children active.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for any child with access to open play area. This thing flies as described. Worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: KIds love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these to have around the house for a visit from two boys, one 31/2 and the other almost 61/2. They had a ball stomping these rockets, chasing after them and bringing them back for another go. These Ultras are bigger than some sets and they really fly. In fact, for bigger kids or adults you need a good amount of space or they will end up in the neighbors' yards etc. We managed to tree one of the rockets and are waiting for a storm to blow it out of the tree. I recommend these for anyone trying to get the kids into some high-energy, outdoor activity.
customer_reviews.author: JumpnJill

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Fun
customer_reviews.text: A rare cheap toy that does break upon first few use and ended up in the land full. Ton of fun and durable for what they are meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: It's a blast
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my line of work with children. I have yet to find a child who hasn't liked stomping on this stomp rocket. I've tried using other stomp rockets made from other companies, but their tubing was made of faulty material and either broke easily or did not provide the right kind of spacing needed to allow forceful air to flow through it. Once the tubing is broken, the stomp rocket is essentially useless. For it's price, you get a fun product that has wonderful replay value. As long as the child can depress the stomp pump hard and fast enough, the rocket will blast off.
customer_reviews.author: justvin

customer_reviews.title: When I opened the sealed box I found it was ...
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the sealed box I found it was missing one of the 3 pieces that makes up the launch stand. It was too late to exchange it. Was a gift and beyond the return time by the time I saw the problem
customer_reviews.author: Marfel

product_meta.title: Stomp Rocket Ultra Rocket, 4 Rockets - Outdoor Rocket Toy Gift for Boys and Girls - Comes with Toy Rocket Launcher - Ages 5 Years and Up
product_meta.description: Stomp Rocket Ultra is 100% KID powered! Run, jump and STOMP to launch these rockets up to 200 feet in the air -- that’s 20 stories high! Stomp Rocket Ultra is strong and durable, and great for active, outdoor play. It has won the Dr. Toy Award, iParenting Media’s Hot Toy Award, Creative Child Magazine’s Preferred Choice Award and iParenting Media’s Excellent Product Award. Includes 4 foam-tipped Ultra Stomp Rockets and a Stomp Launcher. Refill rockets also available (item #20002). For kids ages 5 and up.
feature_bullets: 100% KID powered: Run, jump and STOMP to launch these rockets up to 20 stories high -- that’s 200 feet in the air! No batteries required; easy, fast assembly.
Award-winning products from industry experts, including iParenting Media, Dr. Toy, and Creative Child Magazine.
Includes a Stomp Launcher, 4 foam-tipped Ultra Stomp Rockets that work with three different Stomp Rocket Launch Sets.
Pair with Stomp Rocket Science book and get kids interested in STEM subjects (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) early. Ages 5 and up.
Great for year round fun to get kids away from screen time and more active outside.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,046 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
